meanings.sent1: The cantankerous old man scowled at everyone who passed by.
meanings.sent2: My cat can be cantankerous when she doesn't get her favorite treats.
meanings.sent3: The cantankerous squirrel refused to share his acorns with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The cantankerous storm clouds loomed ominously overhead.
meanings.sent5: The cantankerous teacher yelled at the students for being too noisy.

meanings.definition: Difficult to deal with or work with
meanings.sent1: The cantankerous computer program kept crashing whenever I tried to run it.
meanings.sent2: The old printer was cantankerous and often jammed the paper.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the cantankerous lawnmower was like solving a puzzle with missing pieces.
meanings.sent4: The cantankerous traffic made the commute home unbearable.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with the cantankerous customer was a challenge for the new employee.
